Description: A woman's head-veil. Almost square, with long thin tassels. A yellow cloth, finely woven [48 e.p.i approx], with red and yellow bands in the centre and towards each warp end. Patterning identical about the centre (horizontal) line. Blurred diamond and zigzag patterning, having the appearance of ikat-dyed patterning; weft faced tabby weave and tapestry weave actual techniques used. Worked in yellow, cream, green, light blue, lilac, maroon and purple silk (?) and synthetic (?) yarns and gold-coloured metal-wrapped thread. Blanket stitch embroidery along each warp end and continuing for 9.5 cms along each selvedge. Knotted warp ends, covered with blocks of coloured yarns used in the main ground, using half-hitch knots. The warps are thereafter wrapped with black and white yarns, then braided, with a final tassel at each end.
Production place: Made in: Tunisia (?: source: Julie Hudson)
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 1989-1991, London, Museum of Mankind, 'Palestinian Costume'
